Title: Junior AI/ML Developer
Description:
Lensa is a career site that helps job seekers find great jobs in the US. We are not a staffing firm or agency. Lensa does not hire directly for these jobs, but promotes jobs on LinkedIn on behalf of its direct clients, recruitment ad agencies, and marketing partners. Lensa partners with DirectEmployers to promote this job for Accenture. Clicking "Apply Now" or "Read more" on Lensa redirects you to the job board/employer site. Any information collected there is subject to their terms and privacy notice.

Accenture Flex offers you the flexibility of local fixed-duration project-based work powered by Accenture, a leading global professional services company. Accenture is consistently recognized on FORTUNE's 100 Best Companies to Work For and Diversity Inc's Top 50 Companies For Diversity lists.

As an Accenture Flex employee, you will apply your skills and experience to help drive business transformation for leading organizations and communities. In addition to delivering innovative solutions for Accenture's clients, you will work with a highly skilled, diverse network of people across Accenture businesses who are using the latest emerging technologies to address today's biggest business challenges.

You will receive competitive rewards and access to benefits programs and world-class learning resources. Accenture Flex employees work in their local metro area onsite at the project, significantly reducing and/or eliminating the demands to travel.

Key Responsibilities


Develop APIs to seamlessly integrate external data sources into internal systems, ensuring robust data ingestion pipelines.
Perform data analysis across diverse datasets, identifying trends, anomalies, and actionable insights to support business decision-making.
Develop and deploy analytical models tailored for predictive analytics, classification, and clustering tasks using tools like Python, R.
Collaborat with cross-functional teams to define data requirements, validate model outputs
Continuously monitored and refined models based on real-world feedback and evolving data patterns to maintain accuracy and relevance.


Basic Qualifications

1+ years of experience working with the following:


Python
R
Java Script
HealthCare Domain Knowledge
Statistical Methods using ML
High School Diploma or GED


Preferred Qualifications


Associate's or Bachelor's Degree


Compensation at Accenture varies depending on a wide array of factors, which may include but are not limited to the specific office location, role, skill set, and level of experience. As required by local law, Accenture provides a reasonable range of compensation for roles that may be hired in California, Colorado, District of Columbia, Illinois, Maryland, Minnesota, New Jersey, New York or Washington as set forth below.

We accept applications on an on-going basis and there is no fixed deadline to apply.

Information on benefits is here. (https://www.accenture.com/us-en/careers/local/benefits)

Role Location

California - $25.00 - $35.00/hour

Colorado - $25.00 - $35.00/hour

District of Columbia - $25.00 - $35.00/hour

Illinois - $25.00 - $35.00/hour

Minnesota - $25.00 - $35.00/hour

Maryland - $25.00 - $35.00/hour

New Jersey/New York - $25.00 - $35.00/hour

Washington - $25.00 - $35.00/hour

What We Believe

We have an unwavering commitment to diversity with the aim that every one of our people has a full sense of belonging within our organization. As a business imperative, every person at Accenture has the responsibility to create and sustain an inclusive environment.

Inclusion and diversity are fundamental to our culture and core values. Our rich diversity makes us more innovative and more creative, which helps us better serve our clients and our communities. Read more here (https://www.accenture.com/us-en/about/inclusion-diversity/us-workforce)

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement

Accenture is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe that no one should be discriminated against because of their differences, such as age, disability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity and expression, religion or sexual orientation.

All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law.

Accenture is committed to providing veteran employment opportunities to our service men and women.

For details, view a copy of the Accenture Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Policy Statement (https://www.accenture.com/content/dam/accenture/final/accenture-com/document/Annual-Policy-Statement-Regarding-EEO-2023-Applicant.pdf#zoom=50) .

Requesting An Accommodation

Accenture is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for persons with disabilities or religious observances, including reasonable accommodation when needed. If you are hired by Accenture and require accommodation to perform the essential functions of your role, you will be asked to participate in our reasonable accommodation process. Accommodations made to facilitate the recruiting process are not a guarantee of future or continued accommodations once hired.

If you would like to be considered for employment opportunities with Accenture and have accommodation needs for a disability or religious observance, please call us toll free at 1 (877) 889-9009, send us an email (https://www.accenture.com/us-en/about/contact-us) or speak with your recruiter.

Other Employment Statements

Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States.

Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration.

Job candidates will not be obligated to disclose sealed or expunged records of conviction or arrest as part of the hiring process.

The Company will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. Additionally, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the Company's legal duty to furnish information.

If you have questions about this posting, please contact support@lensa.com

Title: AI - Internship Program - Remote
Description:
We are offering a fast-paced, 2 week graduate internship program designed for students or career changers looking to gain hands-on experience in software development and learn how AI is reshaping the development lifecycle. This is a practical, sprint-style graduate program where you'll work through the full SDLC—from ideation to delivery—on a micro-project designed to simulate real-world experience.




What You’ll Gain:





Practical, portfolio-ready experience across the full SDLC


Exposure to AI tools in software development


Understanding of agile delivery principles and fast iteration


A certificate of completion and personalised feedback


Optional: Letter of recommendation (based on performance)





Time Commitment:





Duration: 2 weeks


Estimated Time: 15 hours per week


Flexible hours, with suggested milestones provided





Compensation:





This is an unpaid graduated program designed for rapid learning and portfolio-building. The experience is educational and intended to provide a springboard for people willing to learn.



Tasks


What You’ll Do:





Participate in a rapid software development project, focused on building a functional MVP (Minimum Viable Product)


Learn and apply key stages of the Software Development Lifecycle:


Requirements gathering


Solution design


Development


Testing


Deployment


Feedback & iteration


Use AI-assisted tools (e.g. GitHub Copilot, ChatGPT, or similar) to speed up ideation, coding, and documentation


Collaborate in a simulated team environment using version control (Git), task boards, and daily check-ins


Present your project outcomes, along with a short write-up of what you learned from each phase of the SDLC



Requirements


Ideal For:





Students in computer science or related fields


Career changers exploring software development


Self-learners seeking structured experience to build a portfolio


Individuals curious about integrating AI into software workflows

  • Continuously monitored and refined models based on real-world feedback and evolving data patterns to maintain accuracy and relevance.

  • HealthCare Domain Knowledge

Title: Data Scientist Junior (MSIC)
Description:
Lensa is a career site that helps job seekers find great jobs in the US. We are not a staffing firm or agency. Lensa does not hire directly for these jobs, but promotes jobs on LinkedIn on behalf of its direct clients, recruitment ad agencies, and marketing partners. Lensa partners with DirectEmployers to promote this job for COLSA. Clicking "Apply Now" or "Read more" on Lensa redirects you to the job board/employer site. Any information collected there is subject to their terms and privacy notice.

Develops and applies interdisciplinary methods, algorithms, statistics, and research techniques in the development of data driven solutions to extract knowledge, provide insights, and present information from data in various structures and unstructured forms.

Principal Duties and Responsibilities (*Essential functions)


Performs analysis of data systems, such as Big Data systems *
May perform statistical analysis and provide input for reports and dashboards
Involved with the development of data products, reports, and dashboards or other display techniques*
Evaluates data, algorithms, and their interaction to improve algorithm performance*
May apply advanced statistics, including natural language processing and machine learning to create solutions.
May assist in data modeling and data virtualization
May write code to preprocess and clean data


At COLSA, people are our most valuable resource and centered at our core value. We invite you to unite your talents with opportunity and be a part of our "Family of Professionals!" Learn about our employee-centric culture and benefits here (http://www.colsa.com/culture_benefits/) .

Required SkillsRequired Experience


Bachelors' degree in technical/applicable related field or equivalent
Minimum of 2 years related experience
Understanding of Artificial Intelligence constructs
Working knowledge of desktop applications such as word processing, spreadsheet, and database programs,
Active DoD Top Secret security clearance with eligibility for DIA-SCI access. Candidate selected must successfully pass a DIA CI polygraph within 180 days of hire
U.S. Citizenship required


Preferred Qualifications


Active DoD Security Clearance
TS/SCI Clearance
The ability to obtain Security + certification within 6 months of hire
Python and Dockers experience preferred


Applicant selected will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. COLSA Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer, Minorities/Females/Veterans/Disabled. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin.

If you have questions about this posting, please contact support@lensa.com

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Lensa is a career site that helps job seekers find great jobs in the US. We are not a staffing firm or agency. Lensa does not hire directly for these jobs, but promotes jobs on LinkedIn on behalf of its direct clients, recruitment ad agencies, and marketing partners. Lensa partners with DirectEmployers to promote this job for Steampunk.com. Clicking "Apply Now" or "Read more" on Lensa redirects you to the job board/employer site. Any information collected there is subject to their terms and privacy notice.

Overview

In today's rapidly evolving technology landscape, an organization's data has never been a more important aspect in achieving mission and business goals. Our data exploitation experts work with our clients to support their mission and business goals by creating and executing a comprehensive data strategy using the best technology and techniques, given the challenge.

At Steampunk , our goal is to build and execute a data strategy for our clients to coordinate data collection and generation, to align the organization and its data assets in support of the mission, and ultimately to realize mission goals with the strongest effectiveness possible.

For our clients, data is a strategic asset. They are looking to become a facts-based, data-driven, customer-focused organization. To help realize this goal, they are leveraging visual analytics platforms to analyze, visualize, and share information. At steampunk you will design and develop solutions to high-impact, complex data problems, working with the best and data practitioners around.

Contributions

We are looking for seasoned Data Scientist to work with our existing team of Data Architects and Developers to develop strategies, create ML/AI solutions, and deliver results. We are looking for a more than just a "Data Scientist", but a technologist with excellent communication and customer service skills and a passion for data and problem solving.


Experience modeling on structured and unstructured data sets
Experience with exploratory data analysis
Experience in feature engineering
Experience in data visualization
Experience with Deep Learning methodology and state of the art libraries
Knowledge of data collection methods, capabilities, and tasking process
Ability to leverage multiple data management tools to organize relevant information and make decisions
Support an Agile software development lifecycle
You will contribute to the growth of our Data Exploitation Practice!


Qualifications


Ability to hold a position of public trust with the US government.
5+ years industry experience developing ML/AI solutions and a passion for solving complex problems.
3+ years direct experience in Data Modeling and Data Solution Development
1+ year performing queue modeling and survival analysis
Bachelor's degree in computer science, information systems, engineering, business, or a scientific or technical discipline
Demonstrated experience manipulating structured and unstructured data for analysis
Strong programming skills in SQL, Python, R, Scala, Java, or similar language
Experience using Python to manipulate large data sets
Experience with DevSecOps, as it applies to data science
Demonstrated experience with TensorFlow, Keras, or other Deep Learning tools and frameworks
Demonstrated experience in big data systems including Hadoop, Spark, Scala
Data visualization skills in Tableau, Power BI, D3, ArcGIS, or similar
Experience with Git, Bash, Unix commands
Experience in Cloud analytics (AWS, Azure, or GCP) with tools such as AWS SageMaker, Azure HDInsight, etc.
Familiarity with Flask is a plus
Knowledge of DBOps and MLOps framework is a plus
Experience with Solr, Elasticsearch, or similar tool is a plus


About Steampunk

Steampunk relies on several factors to determine salary, including but not limited to geographic location, contractual requirements, education, knowledge, skills, competencies, and experience. The projected compensation range for this position is $125,000 to $160,000. The estimate displayed represents a typical annual salary range for this position. Annual salary is just one aspect of Steampunk's total compensation package for employees. Learn more about additional Steampunk benefits here.

Identity Statement

As part of the application process, you are expected to be on camera during interviews and assessments. We reserve the right to take your picture to verify your identity and prevent fraud.

Steampunk is a Change Agent in the Federal contracting industry, bringing new thinking to clients in the Homeland, Federal Civilian, Health and DoD sectors. Through our Human-Centered delivery methodology , we are fundamentally changing the expectations our Federal clients have for true shared accountability in solving their toughest mission challenges. As an employee owned company , we focus on investing in our employees to enable them to do the greatest work of their careers - and rewarding them for outstanding contributions to our growth. If you want to learn more about our story, visit http://www.steampunk.com .

We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Steampunk participates in the E-Verify program.

Refer a Friend (https://careers-steampunk.icims.com/jobs/6041/data-scientist/job?mode=apply&apply=yes&in_iframe=1&hashed=-336029103)

HTML:
Lensa is a career site that helps job seekers find great jobs in the US. We are not a staffing firm or agency. Lensa does not hire directly for these jobs, but promotes jobs on LinkedIn on behalf of its direct clients, recruitment ad agencies, and marketing partners. Lensa partners with DirectEmployers to promote this job for Steampunk.com. Clicking "Apply Now" or "Read more" on Lensa redirects you to the job board/employer site. Any information collected there is subject to their terms and privacy notice.

Overview

In today's rapidly evolving technology landscape, an organization's data has never been a more important aspect in achieving mission and business goals. Our data exploitation experts work with our clients to support their mission and business goals by creating and executing a comprehensive data strategy using the best technology and techniques, given the challenge.

At Steampunk , our goal is to build and execute a data strategy for our clients to coordinate data collection and generation, to align the organization and its data assets in support of the mission, and ultimately to realize mission goals with the strongest effectiveness possible.

For our clients, data is a strategic asset. They are looking to become a facts-based, data-driven, customer-focused organization. To help realize this goal, they are leveraging visual analytics platforms to analyze, visualize, and share information. At steampunk you will design and develop solutions to high-impact, complex data problems, working with the best and data practitioners around.

Contributions

We are looking for seasoned Data Scientist to work with our existing team of Data Architects and Developers to develop strategies, create ML/AI solutions, and deliver results. We are looking for a more than just a "Data Scientist", but a technologist with excellent communication and customer service skills and a passion for data and problem solving.

  • Experience modeling on structured and unstructured data sets
  • Experience with exploratory data analysis
  • Experience in feature engineering
  • Experience in data visualization
  • Experience with Deep Learning methodology and state of the art libraries
  • Knowledge of data collection methods, capabilities, and tasking process
  • Ability to leverage multiple data management tools to organize relevant information and make decisions
  • Support an Agile software development lifecycle
  • You will contribute to the growth of our Data Exploitation Practice!

Qualifications

  • Ability to hold a position of public trust with the US government.
  • 5+ years industry experience developing ML/AI solutions and a passion for solving complex problems.
  • 3+ years direct experience in Data Modeling and Data Solution Development
  • 1+ year performing queue modeling and survival analysis
  • Bachelor's degree in computer science, information systems, engineering, business, or a scientific or technical discipline
  • Demonstrated experience manipulating structured and unstructured data for analysis
  • Strong programming skills in SQL, Python, R, Scala, Java, or similar language
  • Experience using Python to manipulate large data sets
  • Experience with DevSecOps, as it applies to data science
  • Demonstrated experience with TensorFlow, Keras, or other Deep Learning tools and frameworks
  • Demonstrated experience in big data systems including Hadoop, Spark, Scala
  • Data visualization skills in Tableau, Power BI, D3, ArcGIS, or similar
  • Experience with Git, Bash, Unix commands
  • Experience in Cloud analytics (AWS, Azure, or GCP) with tools such as AWS SageMaker, Azure HDInsight, etc.
  • Familiarity with Flask is a plus
  • Knowledge of DBOps and MLOps framework is a plus
  • Experience with Solr, Elasticsearch, or similar tool is a plus

About Steampunk

Steampunk relies on several factors to determine salary, including but not limited to geographic location, contractual requirements, education, knowledge, skills, competencies, and experience. The projected compensation range for this position is $125,000 to $160,000. The estimate displayed represents a typical annual salary range for this position. Annual salary is just one aspect of Steampunk's total compensation package for employees. Learn more about additional Steampunk benefits here.

Identity Statement

As part of the application process, you are expected to be on camera during interviews and assessments. We reserve the right to take your picture to verify your identity and prevent fraud.

Steampunk is a Change Agent in the Federal contracting industry, bringing new thinking to clients in the Homeland, Federal Civilian, Health and DoD sectors. Through our Human-Centered delivery methodology , we are fundamentally changing the expectations our Federal clients have for true shared accountability in solving their toughest mission challenges. As an employee owned company , we focus on investing in our employees to enable them to do the greatest work of their careers - and rewarding them for outstanding contributions to our growth. If you want to learn more about our story, visit http://www.steampunk.com .

We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Steampunk participates in the E-Verify program.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Lensa is a career site that helps job seekers find great jobs in the US. We are not a staffing firm or agency. Lensa does not hire directly for these jobs, but promotes jobs on LinkedIn on behalf of its direct clients, recruitment ad agencies, and marketing partners. Lensa partners with DirectEmployers to promote this job for META. Clicking "Apply Now" or "Read more" on Lensa redirects you to the job board/employer site. Any information collected there is subject to their terms and privacy notice.

Summary

Meta Platforms, Inc. (Meta), formerly known as Facebook Inc., builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps and services like Messenger, Instagram, and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. To apply, click “Apply to Job” online on this web page.

Required Skills

Data Scientist Responsibilities:


Utilize advanced knowledge of quantitative analysis, management science, data mining, mathematics, Hadoop/Hive, SQL, Excel, and presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand how our users interact with both our consumer and business products.
Identify actionable insights, suggest recommendations and influence the direction of Security strategy by effectively communicating results to cross functional groups, including Security strategy leadership.
Leverage data and mathematical principles to provide insights about user behavior, inform business decisions based on data mining and large, complex data sets, and solve large scale data infrastructure problems.
Predict and understand user patterns through metric analysis.
Work cross functionally to define problem statements, collect data, build analytical models and make recommendations.
Develop mathematical models and perform data analysis to drive insights to improve Meta’s operations.
Partner with Product and Engineering teams to solve problems and identify trends and opportunities.
Build and analyze dashboards, reports and key data sets to empower operations and exploratory analysis.
Automate analyses and author data pipelines via SQL and Python based ETL framework.
Develop strong business partnerships with Security strategy leadership by translating strategic questions into structured analyses, defining success metrics, and developing reporting channels.
Assist in designing hypothesis testing experiments, analyze data collected, and present results.
Conduct ad hoc data analysis based on current team needs.
Complete root cause analysis of different workflows in order to quantify problems, operationalize goals and identify priorities.
Answering big picture questions by framing the question, turning it into an analytical plan, executing and communicating to stakeholders.
Initiating and driving projects to completion in a high cross-functional environment.
Telecommute from anywhere in the US permitted.


Minimum Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications:


Requires a Master’s degree (or foreign degree equivalent) in Analytics, Operations Research, Statistics, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Applied Sciences, Mathematics, or related field, and 5 years of experience in job offered or in an analyst-related occupation.
Requires 60 months of experience in each of the following:
Solving analytical problems and building models using quantitative, statistical or machine learning approaches
Machine Learning, Statistics, or other data analysis tools and techniques
Performing data extraction, cleaning, analysis and presentation for medium to large datasets
At least one programming language: Python, R, Java, or C++
Writing SQL queries
Scientific computing and analysis packages: NumPy, SciPy, Pandas, Scikit-learn, dplyr, or ggplot2
Statistics methods: inferential, forecasting, time series, hypothesis testing, clustering and regression analysis
Data visualization libraries: Matplotlib, Pyplot, or ggplot2
Working with distributed computing tools: Hadoop, Hive, or Spark
and 10. Applied statistics or experimentation, such as A/B testing.

Public Compensation

$217,553/year to $235,400/year + bonus + equity + benefits

Industry: Internet

Equal Opportunity

Meta is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Meta participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law. Please note that Meta may leverage artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies in connection with applications for employment.

Meta is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

If you have questions about this posting, please contact support@lensa.com

Title: ML Engineer
Description:
About The Company

Sanofi is a leading global healthcare company dedicated to transforming scientific innovation into healthcare solutions that improve people's lives. With a rich history of pioneering research and development, Sanofi focuses on delivering innovative medicines, vaccines, and consumer healthcare products. The company is committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive work environment, promoting continuous learning, and advancing digital transformation initiatives to stay at the forefront of the healthcare industry. Sanofi's mission is to chase the miracles of science to create better health outcomes worldwide, making a meaningful difference in the lives of millions.

About The Role

The MLOps Engineer will play a crucial role in Sanofi’s ongoing digital transformation efforts, specifically supporting the deployment, management, and scaling of AI and machine learning solutions across various departments. This position is based in Downtown Toronto, Ontario, with a hybrid work model requiring three days onsite. The ideal candidate will work within an agile development team to design, build, and maintain cloud-hosted AI/ML products, ensuring seamless operations, monitoring, and lifecycle management of deployed models. The role involves collaborating with data scientists, data engineers, and stakeholders to develop automated pipelines, implement best practices, and support continuous improvement in AI/ML workflows. The MLOps Engineer will also be responsible for maintaining enterprise standards, creating documentation, and researching emerging tools and technologies to enhance Sanofi’s AI capabilities.

Qualifications

University degree (Bachelor’s, Master’s, or PhD) in Computer Science, Information Systems, Software Engineering, or a related quantitative field
Minimum of 2 years of experience in building, deploying, monitoring, and maintaining AI/ML applications in cloud environments
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python and familiarity with MLOps tools (e.g., Github, Argo, Metaflow, WandB, Snowflake, AWS SageMaker)
Experience implementing CI/CD pipelines for AI/ML applications
Hands-on experience with large-scale data and ML pipelines deployment
Knowledge of relational databases (e.g., Postgres SQL) and non-relational databases (e.g., Graph, Vector databases)
Experience with visualization tools such as Python DASH, Tableau, or PowerBI
Proficiency in developing and maintaining backend APIs (e.g., REST)
Experience provisioning cloud infrastructure using Infrastructure as Code tools like Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform
Understanding of compliance standards (e.g., data privacy, GxP, SOX) and cybersecurity principles is a plus
Ability to work effectively in an agile team supporting cross-functional collaboration

Responsibilities

Design, develop, and maintain cloud-based AI/ML products with automated pipelines for training, inference, and model retraining
Implement and optimize automated ML pipelines in collaboration with data scientists and data engineers
Support the entire lifecycle management of deployed AI/ML applications, including versioning, updates, monitoring, and troubleshooting
Establish and maintain enterprise standards for MLOps, including documentation, user guides, release notes, and FAQs
Create reusable processes and components to support seamless ML operations, including app monitoring and customer support
Engage with stakeholders and solution partners to review product development needs and provide technical guidance
Maintain effective communication with end-users and develop educational content related to AI/ML lifecycle events
Research emerging tools and technologies to continuously improve Sanofi’s AI/ML infrastructure and practices

Benefits

Opportunity to work in a pioneering environment focused on healthcare innovation
Competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package
Health and wellness programs including high-quality healthcare coverage
Professional development opportunities and career growth within a global organization
Supportive team environment fostering collaboration and innovation
Flexible hybrid work model to promote work-life balance

Equal Opportunity

Sanofi is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace. We welcome applications from all qualified individuals regardless of race, gender, age, disability, sexual orientation, or background. We are dedicated to providing accommodations for persons with disabilities during the recruitment process upon request.

Title: Healthcare Specialist (AI Data Trainer, Part Time, WFH)
Description:
We're Hiring Medical Researcher For Training the Data of AI Models (Remote, Flexible Working hours) | Earn Between $6,000 - $11,000/Month Weekly Payout




About the Role:

Are you a medical professional (Students MBBS / Nursing / BDS / BPT / Allied Health) with a passion for advancing AI? We are seeking medical experts to contribute to the training and refinement of cutting-edge artificial intelligence models. In this fully remote and flexible role, you will leverage your clinical knowledge to enhance AI's ability to perform diagnostic and reasoning tasks with precision and accuracy.




Who Can Join?

Medical consultants
Students MBBS / Nursing / BDS / BPT / Allied Health
Health professionals, This includes doctors, nurses, physician assistants, and various allied health professionals like therapists, dietitians, and technicians




What You'll Do:

Create and answer complex clinical questions to train AI in diagnostic and reasoning tasks.
Review and analyse AI model responses for clinical soundness, scientific rigour, and relevance.
Rank and assess AI outputs to identify strengths, weaknesses, and opportunities for improvement.
Provide expert feedback to help improve the quality, accuracy, and logic of AI-generated content.
You may be assigned to different projects based on your expertise and performance.




What We're Looking For:

Medical Degree: MD, DO, MBBS, or equivalent from an accredited medical program (currently enrolled candidates may also be considered).
Clinical Experience: Hands-on experience in a healthcare setting; strong preference for practising or recently practising clinicians.
Subject Mastery: Ability to develop and critique complex, graduate-level medical reasoning tasks.
English Proficiency: Fluent in reading and writing, with minimal language errors.
Analytical Skill: Detail-oriented with the ability to evaluate medical content for accuracy and logical flow.




Compensation & Terms:

Base Rate: Up to $50/hour USD, depending on qualifications, location, project type, and performance.
Location: Fully remote — available to candidates in supported geographies.
Schedule: Fully flexible — work as much or as little as you’d like.
Payouts: Weekly.




Apply Now!

Show more

What We're Looking For:

  • Medical Degree: MD, DO, MBBS, or equivalent from an accredited medical program (currently enrolled candidates may also be considered).
  • Clinical Experience: Hands-on experience in a healthcare setting; strong preference for practising or recently practising clinicians.
  • Subject Mastery: Ability to develop and critique complex, graduate-level medical reasoning tasks.
  • English Proficiency: Fluent in reading and writing, with minimal language errors.
  • Analytical Skill: Detail-oriented with the ability to evaluate medical content for accuracy and logical flow.


Compensation & Terms:

  • Base Rate: Up to $50/hour USD, depending on qualifications, location, project type, and performance.
  • Location: Fully remote — available to candidates in supported geographies.
  • Schedule: Fully flexible — work as much or as little as you’d like.
  • Payouts: Weekly.


Apply Now!

Title: ML Engineer/ Data Scientist, Sr.
Description:
About The Company

Autodesk is a global leader in design software, empowering innovators across various industries to create a better world. With a rich history of pioneering technology, Autodesk provides cutting-edge solutions that enable the design, engineering, and manufacturing of sustainable, efficient, and innovative products and structures. From architecture and construction to manufacturing and media, Autodesk's software tools are integral to transforming ideas into reality. The company values creativity, inclusivity, and sustainability, fostering a culture that encourages continuous learning and collaboration. Autodesk is committed to diversity and inclusion, ensuring that all employees have the opportunity to thrive and contribute to meaningful projects that impact society positively.

About The Role

The Growth Experience Technology (GET) team at Autodesk is seeking a highly experienced Senior Staff Data Scientist/Machine Learning Engineer to spearhead data-driven initiatives that enhance the company's B2C eCommerce platform. This role is pivotal in shaping the future of Autodesk’s digital customer experience by developing advanced machine learning models and algorithms that personalize user interactions, optimize recommendations, and improve overall engagement. The ideal candidate will possess a blend of research expertise and engineering proficiency, capable of translating complex data insights into impactful business strategies. This position offers flexibility with remote work options within the U.S. and Canada, with a preference for candidates located in San Francisco.

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in data science, statistics, computer science, or related technical field
Minimum of 10 years of experience leading technical projects, ML design, and managing industry-scale ML infrastructure
At least 7 years of experience in software design, architecture, testing, and deployment
Extensive hands-on experience with data mining and information retrieval techniques
Proficiency in A/B testing and experimental design methodologies
Strong understanding of statistics, probability, and financial modeling
Ability to interpret data insights and translate them into actionable business recommendations

Preferred qualifications include a Master’s or PhD in a quantitative discipline, over 15 years of experience in machine learning development and deployment, and familiarity with cloud ML platforms such as AWS or Azure, along with MLOps best practices.

Responsibilities

Champion a data-driven culture by promoting best practices and guiding strategic data science initiatives across teams
Design, prototype, and scale end-to-end machine learning pipelines to enhance personalization and customer engagement at Autodesk
Develop and implement robust experimentation frameworks to enable rapid iteration while maintaining scientific rigor
Analyze data and ML model outputs to craft compelling stories and provide logical, impactful recommendations
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to lead and execute large-scale, complex projects aligned with strategic business goals
Partner with senior leadership to prioritize projects, provide technical guidance, and advocate for data-driven decision-making
Mentor junior data scientists and machine learning engineers, assisting with project planning, technical decisions, and code reviews

Benefits

Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance plans
Retirement savings options and financial wellness programs
Generous paid time off and holidays
Flexible work arrangements and remote work opportunities
Continuous learning and professional development resources
Employee wellness programs and work-life balance initiatives

Equal Opportunity

At Autodesk, we are committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristic.

Title: Artificial Intelligence (AI) Engineer
Description:
About The Company

General Motors (GM) is a global leader in the automotive industry committed to pioneering innovative transportation solutions. With a focus on sustainability, safety, and cutting-edge technology, GM strives to shape the future of mobility. The company’s vision encompasses achieving zero crashes, zero emissions, and zero congestion, reflecting its dedication to creating a safer, cleaner, and more efficient world. GM’s diverse portfolio includes electric vehicles, autonomous driving systems, and advanced connectivity features, all developed through a culture of innovation and excellence. The organization values inclusion, collaboration, and continuous improvement, fostering an environment where talented professionals can thrive and make a meaningful impact on the future of transportation.

About The Role

We are seeking a highly experienced Principal Staff Artificial Intelligence Engineer to join our Simulation and Testing organization remotely. This pivotal role involves leading the strategy and execution of simulation-based validation efforts for autonomous vehicle development. The successful candidate will guide a team of engineers in establishing best practices, driving innovation in testing methodologies, and ensuring the safety and performance of autonomous systems within complex simulated environments. While the position is remote, candidates residing within a 50-mile radius of Atlanta, Austin, Detroit, Warren, Milford, or Mountain View are expected to report to the designated location at least three times a week. This role offers an exciting opportunity to influence the future of autonomous vehicle validation and contribute to GM’s mission of safer, smarter mobility solutions.

Qualifications

Master’s degree in Robotics, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related technical field.
Minimum of 10 years of extensive experience in simulation and testing, preferably within the autonomous vehicle domain.
Proven track record in developing or testing large-scale Machine Learning systems.
Strong understanding of simulation platforms, methodologies, and validation techniques.
Hands-on expertise in implementing robust validation methods, including defining relevant metrics and correlating simulation results with real-world behavior.
Proficiency in programming languages relevant to simulation and testing.
Excellent communication, collaboration, and mentoring skills.

Preferred qualifications include a Ph.D. in a related field and 15 or more years of experience in simulation and testing for autonomous vehicles.

Responsibilities

Lead the design, development, and implementation of simulation-based validation strategies to ensure safety and performance standards are met for autonomous systems.
Guide and mentor a team of engineers, fostering a culture of innovation, continuous learning, and technical excellence.
Define and execute sophisticated validation methods and evaluation strategies within simulation frameworks, including the creation of challenging test scenarios and comprehensive analysis of results at scale.
Collaborate cross-functionally with autonomous system development teams to integrate simulation testing seamlessly into the overall development lifecycle.
Influence technical roadmaps and strategic priorities, aligning simulation efforts with broader company objectives and product milestones.
Stay abreast of emerging technologies and industry standards to continuously enhance simulation capabilities and validation methodologies.

Benefits

Competitive salary range of $225,000 to $344,800, commensurate with experience and qualifications.
Performance-based bonus potential and incentive pay programs.
Comprehensive health and wellbeing benefits, including medical, dental, vision, and Health Savings Accounts.
Retirement savings plans, paid vacation and holidays, and tuition assistance programs.
Employee assistance programs and GM vehicle discounts.
Eligibility for a company vehicle evaluation program, with the opportunity to drive and evaluate GM vehicles.
Potential relocation benefits for suitable candidates.

Equal Opportunity

General Motors is committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace where all employees are valued and respected. We provide equal employment opportunities regardless of sex, race, color, national origin, citizenship status, religion, age, disability, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, or any other protected characteristic.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
What You'll Do

We’re building cloud-based tax compliance solutions to handle every transaction in the world. Imagine every transaction you make — every tank of gas, cup of coffee, or pair of sneakers, every movie ticket, meal kit, or streamed song, every sensor-to-sensor ping. Nearly every time you make a purchase, physical or digital, there’s an accompanying unique and nuanced tax compliance calculation.

POSITION: Machine Learning Engineer

WORK LOCATION: Durham, NC (telecommuting permitted from anywhere within the U.S.)

JOB DUTIES: Utilize machine learning to create new products/features and internal platform for text analytics and content acquisition & delivery. Develop and program integrated software algorithms to structure, analyze and leverage data in product and systems applications in both structured and unstructured environments for new product design projects. Develop and communicate descriptive, diagnostic, predictive and prescriptive insights/algorithms. Use machine language and statistical modeling techniques such as decision trees, logistic regression, Bayesian analysis and others to develop and evaluate algorithms to improve product/system performance, quality, data management and accuracy for product/systems improvement projects. Implement and improve environments and use current programming language and technologies to translate algorithms and technical specifications into code for theoretical development environments and specific product design projects. Complete programming and implements efficiencies, performs testing and debugging. Complete documentation and procedures for installation and maintenance. Apply deep learning technologies to give computers the capability to visualize, learn and respond to complex situations. Adapt machine learning to areas such as virtual reality, augmented reality, artificial intelligence, robotics, and other products that allow users to have an interactive experience. Work with large scale computing frameworks, data analysis systems and modeling environments. Telecommuting permitted from anywhere within the U.S.

What You'll Need to be Successful

Required Qualifications

Masters degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field;


6 months of experience in machine learning (ML), including 6 months of experience in each of the following:
ML techniques, including classification, regression, and clustering;
ML Platforms, including TensorFlow, Amazon SageMaker, PyTorch, and/or Scikit-learn;
Feature engineering;
Hyperparameter;
Data visualization; and
Coding using Java and/or Python.
All experience may be gained concurrently.

How We'll Take Care of You

Total Rewards

In addition to a great compensation package, paid time off, and paid parental leave, many Avalara employees are eligible for bonuses.

Health & Wellness

Benefits vary by location but generally include private medical, life, and disability insurance.

Inclusive culture and diversity

Avalara strongly supports diversity, equity, and inclusion, and is committed to integrating them into our business practices and our organizational culture. We also have a total of 8 employee-run resource groups, each with senior leadership and exec sponsorship.

Flexible hybrid working

We support hybrid work and flexible schedules for our employees.

Learn more about our benefits by region here: https://careers.avalara.com/

TO APPLY AND BENEFITS: Base pay may be based on various factors, such as geographic location, candidate experience and qualifications, as well as market and business considerations. This role is eligible for an annual bonus based on individual and company performance depending on the terms of the applicable plan and the employee’s role. Company benefits include medical, dental, and vision coverage, life, AD&D, and disability insurance, a 401(k) retirement plan, 17 days of PTO annually, 12 paid holidays, paid parental leave, an employee assistance program, and subsidized transportation options for commuters. All benefits are subject to eligibility requirements and Avalara reserves the right to modify or change these benefits programs at any time, with or without notice, unless otherwise required by law.

TO APPLY: See https://careers.avalara.com/north-america and search under ID 2024-13543.

About Avalara

We’re Avalara. We’re defining the relationship between tax and tech.

We’ve already built an industry-leading cloud compliance platform, processing nearly 40 billion customer API calls and over 5 million tax returns a year.

Last year, we became a billion-dollar business, and our tribe expanded by a cool thousand people - there’s nearly 5,000 of us now. Our growth is real, and we’re not slowing down - not until we’ve achieved our mission - to be part of every transaction in the world.

We’re bright, innovative and disruptive, like the orange we love to wear. It captures our quirky spirit and optimistic mindset. It shows off the culture we’ve designed, that empowers our people to win. Ownership and achievement go hand in hand here. We instill passion in our people through the trust we place in them.

We’ve been different from day one. Join us, and your career will be too.

EEO Statement

We’re an Equal Opportunity Employer. Supporting diversity and inclusion is a cornerstone of our company — we don’t want people to fit into our culture, but to enrich it. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, age, gender, national orientation, disability, sexual orientation, US Veteran status, or any other factor protected by law. If you require any reasonable adjustments during the recruitment process, please let us know.

Title: Quantitative Researcher - Early Career (USA)
Description:
Lensa is a career site that helps job seekers find great jobs in the US. We are not a staffing firm or agency. Lensa does not hire directly for these jobs, but promotes jobs on LinkedIn on behalf of its direct clients, recruitment ad agencies, and marketing partners. Lensa partners with DirectEmployers to promote this job for Trexquant Investment. Clicking "Apply Now" or "Read more" on Lensa redirects you to the job board/employer site. Any information collected there is subject to their terms and privacy notice.

Trexquant is a systematic hedge fund where we use thousands of statistical algorithms to trade equity, futures and other markets globally. Starting with many data sets, we develop large sets of features and use various machine learning methods to discover trading signals and effectively combine them into market-neutral portfolios. We are looking for data scientists, physicists, engineers, economists and programmers to develop the next generation of machine learning strategies that can accurately predict the future movements of liquid financial assets.

Alpha Researcher

Our Quantitative Researchers are embedded within the following teams:

As a member of the Alpha Researcher team, you will be involved in developing market-neutral signals, parsing and analyzing large data sets and collaborating with the Data and Strategy Research team to build a diverse set of predictive models.

Data Scientist

As a member of the Data Science team, you will be involved in parsing and analyzing large data sets, working on discovering and obtaining new sources of data and collaborating with the Alpha and Strategy team to build predictive machine learning models.

Strategy Researcher

As a member of the Strategy team, you will be developing systematic strategies based on a variety of machine learning and statistical methods. The data you train and validate comes from actual market trading

When you apply for a Quantitative Researcher role at Trexquant, we will first assess you on the core skills required for the Quantitative Researcher. During the interview process, we will be able to get to know you better, learn about your strengths and match you to the best research team that closely aligns with your skills and preference.

Your Responsibilities


Design, implement, and optimize various machine learning models aimed at predicting liquid assets using a wide set of financial data and a vast library of trading signals
Parse data sets to be used for future alpha(strategy) development
Investigate and implement state-of-the-art academic research in the field of quantitative finance
Collaborate with experienced and resourceful quantitative researchers to carry out experiments and test hypothesis using simulations


Requirements


BS/MS/PhD degree in any stem field
Passion for machine learning
Fluent with programming languages like Python
Strong problem-solving skills
Ability to work effectively both as an individual and a team player
Knowledge of financial accounting is a plus
Background in quantitative finance is a plus but not necessary


Benefits


Competitive salary plus bonus based on individual and company performance
Collaborative, casual, and friendly work environment
PPO Health, dental and vision insurance premiums fully covered for you and your dependents
Pre-tax commuter benefits
Weekly company meals


Trexquant is an Equal Opportunity Employer

If you have questions about this posting, please contact support@lensa.com

Title: Research Associate
Description:
Job Title: Cell Biology Associate (Contract, 6 months with option for extension)

Overview

The Cell Biology Associate will play an integral role in executing experimental work across multiple internal projects, with a focus on siRNA delivery programs at ProteinQure. This hands-on laboratory role will involve mammalian cell culture and the application of molecular and cellular biology techniques such as Western blotting, flow cytometry, and RT-PCR to assess protein expression, cell binding, and target transcript knockdown. The position will also offer exposure to work with peptides. This is an excellent growth opportunity for a recent graduate with a science degree and at least one year of laboratory experience who is eager to expand their skills in a collaborative, industry-based research environment.

Key Responsibilities

Maintain and passage mammalian cell lines
Generate and characterize stable mammalian cell lines
Perform Western blots to evaluate protein expression
Conduct flow cytometry for cell binding and expression analysis
Perform RT-PCR to assess target transcript knockdown
Conduct peptide characterization studies, including assessment of stability, binding, and aggregation
Support laboratory operations, including ordering supplies, tracking invoices and inventory, and shipping samples
Contribute to additional ad hoc laboratory or operational tasks as needed
Presenting experimental findings in weekly group meetings

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Biochemistry, Molecular Biology, Cell Biology or similar (Master’s degree preferred)
Minimum of 1 year hands-on mammalian cell culture experience
Familiarity with Western blotting, flow cytometry, RT-qPCR, and cell-based assays (asset)
Experience working with peptides or other biologics (asset)
Strong attention to detail, organization, and record-keeping
Ability to work independently while contributing effectively in a team environment

The position will also offer exposure to work with peptides. This is an excellent growth opportunity for a recent graduate with a science degree and at least one year of laboratory experience who is eager to expand their skills in a collaborative, industry-based research environment.

Key Responsibilities

  • Maintain and passage mammalian cell lines
  • Generate and characterize stable mammalian cell lines
  • Perform Western blots to evaluate protein expression
  • Conduct flow cytometry for cell binding and expression analysis
  • Perform RT-PCR to assess target transcript knockdown
  • Conduct peptide characterization studies, including assessment of stability, binding, and aggregation
  • Support laboratory operations, including ordering supplies, tracking invoices and inventory, and shipping samples
  • Contribute to additional ad hoc laboratory or operational tasks as needed
  • Presenting experimental findings in weekly group meetings

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Biochemistry, Molecular Biology, Cell Biology or similar (Master’s degree preferred)
  • Minimum of 1 year hands-on mammalian cell culture experience
  • Familiarity with Western blotting, flow cytometry, RT-qPCR, and cell-based assays (asset)
  • Experience working with peptides or other biologics (asset)
  • Strong attention to detail, organization, and record-keeping
  • Ability to work independently while contributing effectively in a team environment

Title: Python Developer
Description:
About The Company

SynMax is a pioneering geospatial data analytics company built on the principle of "Why guess when you can know." We deliver AI-powered intelligence to the maritime and energy sectors, transforming satellite imagery, AIS feeds, and market data into actionable insights through our platforms: Hyperion (energy intelligence), Theia (maritime domain awareness), Leviaton (LNG tracking), and Vulcan (power monitoring). With offices in Houston and London, we're a diverse team of engineers, data scientists, intelligence analysts, and industry experts dedicated to bringing transparency to traditionally opaque industries.

About The Role

We are seeking a skilled Python Developer to join our growing engineering team and help build the backbone of our industry-disrupting analytics platforms. In this role, you will be responsible for developing robust, scalable software systems with a focus on API development, data integration, and cloud infrastructure. This is an exceptional opportunity for someone who thrives in a fast-paced startup environment and aims to grow alongside a rapidly expanding company. As we scale, you will have the chance to influence our technical architecture, development practices, and future product roadmap. We are open to candidates with a minimum of 2+ years of experience, depending on skills and fit.

Qualifications


Strong experience in writing production-grade Python code and designing scalable systems
Proven experience with RESTful API design and implementation
Familiarity with deploying applications in cloud environments, preferably GCP
Experience with automated deployment pipelines and testing frameworks (unit and integration tests)
Understanding of secure data handling and data governance practices
Eligibility to work in the US or UK
Excellent problem-solving skills and a proactive mindset
Ability to work effectively in a collaborative and dynamic environment


Responsibilities


Design and deploy production-grade Python microservices and APIs emphasizing scalability, performance, and API-first design principles
Develop internal packages and shared tooling to enhance platform capabilities
Create automated web data scrapers and process data for integration into data stores
Integrate various external APIs and securely handle proprietary customer data
Build and maintain data pipelines, implement data wrangling solutions, and develop real-time streaming systems for large-scale geospatial datasets
Deploy and manage applications within cloud environments (preferably GCP), ensuring comprehensive monitoring and performance optimization
Participate in architectural discussions and technical decision-making processes
Stay updated with emerging technologies and trends related to data processing and cloud computing


Benefits


Competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, and vision coverage
Significant growth opportunities as a key member of our early technical team
Collaborative and innovative work environment fostering professional development
Fully remote role with access to our Houston and London offices
Direct impact on products used by major energy companies and government agencies
Mentorship from experienced engineers and technical leaders
Support for conference attendance and continuing education initiatives
Opportunities to influence engineering practices and product development direction


Equal Opportunity

SynMax is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability, or any other protected characteristic. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to these factors.
